title: China’s Response to Peng Shuai Allegations Follows Familiar Pattern
sub_head: Chinese state media journalists circulated videos of the tennis star after a public absence
body:
HONG KONG—Beijing has turned to a familiar playbook to deflect criticism and minimize discussion in China about a tennis star, analysts and rights activists say, as it faces global questions about sexual-assault allegations against a retired senior Communist Party official.
The Chinese government and social-media companies have heavily censored discussions within the country about three-time Olympian Peng Shuai, while Chinese state-media journalists have released photos and videos on Twitter —a platform blocked in China—that are meant to attest to Ms. Peng’s well-being.
